intro: Dryandra foliolata, commonly known as the King River dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, urn-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it is adapted to grow in sandy, well-drained soils. Dryandra foliolata is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters and is often found in heathland and open forest habitats.
